comment.author: 52706710@N03
comment._content: The four evenly-spaced, raked funnels of the ship in the left-centre and the long fo'c'sle are characteristic of earlier generations of British-built light cruiser. Possibly HMAS Sydney or HMAS Melbourne? Four-funnelled American cruisers had two groups of 2 funnels, a short fo'c'sle and a short quarterdeck.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/kaputniq] Thank you again for your observations! We have put this info into our database. :)
